DOCNAME: FAMILJEN DENEV PENSIONSSTIFTELSE and DENEV v. SWEDEN
TEXT: The first applicant is a NORP foundation . The second applicant , a NORP and NORP national , is a member of the board of directors of the first applicant . The Government are represented by PERSON , ORG .
A.
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the second applicant sold CARDINAL pieces of real property to the first applicant , CARDINAL of which were agricultural estates .

On DATE , pursuant to sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Act on Foreign Acquisitions of ORG etc . ( ORG om utländska förvärv av fast egendom m.m . , PERSON ; hereinafter “ the DATE LAW ) , the first applicant submitted a request to ORG ( länsstyrelsen ) of GPE for a permit to retain the acquired properties .
On DATE the request was submitted to ORG ( lantbruksnämnden ) for an opinion . The opinion of ORG was received at ORG on DATE .

On DATE the first applicant stated , inter alia , that ORG opinion was illegal and should therefore not be taken into account . Furthermore , the first applicant wanted immediately to obtain a decision regarding those property units which were not agricultural or forestry properties .

On DATE ORG informed ORG ( kommunstyrelsen ) of GPE about the first applicant ’s request and asked ORG to inform ORG not DATE whether it was going to make use of its right to acquire the properties in accordance with ORG , CARDINAL ; hereinafter “ the DATE Act ” ) .
On DATE the decision of ORG of Malung not to use its right to acquire the properties arrived at ORG . The decision was dated DATE .

On DATE the first applicant submitted a request for a permit to retain CARDINAL of the property units in the matter . It stated that the bill of sale of DATE , on which its earlier application was based , had become invalid due to the lengthy handling of the case . On DATE the first applicant made additional submissions .
On DATE ORG decided to grant the first applicant ’s request for acquisition permits with respect to several of the property units in question .

On DATE the first applicant submitted to ORG a request for a permit to retain CARDINAL of the property units in the matter . The application was based on a deed of gift according to which the second applicant assigned the CARDINAL units to the first applicant . The deed was dated DATE .

On DATE the first applicant submitted a request for a permit to retain CARDINAL property units . This request was based on CARDINAL bills of sale , CARDINAL of which was going to replace the deed of gift of CARDINAL DATE with respect to CARDINAL of the units . On DATE the first applicant submitted further observations .

By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG , following a recommendation of ORG , rejected the first applicant ’s request in respect of CARDINAL of the agricultural estates . In so doing , ORG relied on LAW , LAW of LAW , according to which a permit to acquire a property shall be refused if such a permit would have been refused under LAW ( ORG , ORG ; hereinafter “ the DATE LAW ) .

On DATE the first applicant appealed against the decision . On DATE ORG transmitted the case file to the Government . The first applicant submitted observations on CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE and on DATE .

On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of DATE . They found that , as of DATE , LAW had been replaced by LAW Lagen om tillstånd till vissa förvärv av fast egendom , CARDINAL ; hereinafter “ the DATE LAW ) , the transitional rules of which stipulated that the new legislation was to be observed regardless of whether the acquisition had occurred before or after the entering into force of the DATE Act . For this reason , so the ORG stated , the first applicant ’s request had to be considered on the basis of the DATE Act . Finding that this should be done at first instance , they referred the case back to ORG .

By decision of CARDINAL DATE , ORG found that the DATE LAW as opposed to LAW did not apply to NORP foundations . Thus , under LAW , no permit was required for the first applicant ’s acquisition of the agricultural estates . ORG noted , however , that acquisitions by NORP foundations of agricultural holdings were subject to public approval under other legislation , viz . LAW . Being the competent authority to deal also with requests for acquisition permits according to LAW , the ORG decided to consider the first applicant ’s request on the basis of the said act . In the decision of CARDINAL DATE the request was rejected . ORG stated the following :
( Translation )
“ Under LAW of the [ CARDINAL LAW ... , a legal person may only be issued an acquisition permit if
CARDINAL . the legal person relinquishes or can be expected to relinquish land which is of significance for the rationalisation of agriculture or forestry and , in terms of
size or value , is equivalent or almost equivalent to the land acquired by the legal person ,
CARDINAL . the acquisition has the consequence that land already belonging to the legal person becomes more suitable for its purpose ,
CARDINAL . the land is intended for other purposes than agriculture or forestry ,
CARDINAL . there are other particular reasons .

In ORG opinion , none of the conditions stated in [ LAW ] has been fulfilled in the instant case . The agricultural holdings are situated in areas where the partition of land is inappropriate and where efforts are being made to improve the general layout of estates . For this reason , all of the holdings , regardless of size , are of significance to agriculture and forestry . The fact that holdings may have been given low rateable values [ taxeringsvärden ] does not constitute particular reasons within the meaning of [ LAW ] . Thus , a permit to acquire the properties shall be refused . ”
Following the first applicant ’s appeals , ORG decision was upheld by ORG ( ORG jordbruksverk ) on DATE and ORG ( kammarrätten ) in GPE on DATE .

On DATE the first applicant lodged an appeal with ORG ( Regeringsrätten ) . On DATE the first applicant was requested to submit its appeal petition in the original . This was done on DATE . On DATE and DATE and on CARDINAL DATE the first applicant submitted further observations . It stated , inter alia , that ORG would commit a deliberate crime of omission against the will of ORG if it did not quash the criminal judgment of ORG .

On DATE ORG refused the first applicant leave to appeal . Thus , on DATE , ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE gained legal force . As a consequence , the first applicant ’s purchase of the CARDINAL agricultural estates became invalid .
B. Relevant domestic law
a. Permission to acquire certain real property

At the time of the first applicant ’s acquisition of the land in question , a permit was required for acquisition of land in accordance with LAW . Without such a permit the purchase became null and void . Thus , according to LAW , potential purchasers of real property , with respect to which LAW applied , could not acquire real property without an acquisition permit . With certain exceptions , not relevant to the present case , LAW was applicable to NORP foundations like the first applicant .

An application for an acquisition permit was to be submitted not DATE after the acquisition ( LAW , LAW ) . The acquisition was invalid if a permit had not been applied for within the prescribed time or if a permit was refused ( LAW , LAW ) . Questions relating to acquisitions were examined by ORG ( Chapter CARDINAL , LAW ) . A permit was not granted if it would have been refused in connection with an examination in accordance with LAW .

LAW was repealed on DATE when the DATE Act entered into force . According to the transitional provisions of LAW , this LAW shall apply even when the acquisition took place before its entry into force , except in cases where the acquisition did not require a permit under LAW in force at the time of the acquisition . Under LAW , an acquisition permit is required in certain cases in connection with the acquisition of real property which for taxation purposes is to be regarded as a small house or as agricultural property . However , a permit is not required under LAW when the purchaser is a NORP legal entity ( LAW ) ) . On the other hand , as regards agricultural property , there is a permit requirement under LAW .

LAW is applicable , inter alia , in connection with acquisition of agricultural property by purchase , exchange or gift ( LAW ) . Under LAW , an acquisition permit is required , inter alia , when the acquirer is a legal entity ( LAW ) . As a rule , permit matters are examined by ORG of the county within which the property is situated .

The material rules for granting permits are found in Sections CARDINAL–CARDINAL of LAW . LAW contains provisions on granting an acquisition permit to a legal entity . As examples of when a permit may be granted could be mentioned cases where the acquisition means that the land already in the purchaser ’s possession will become more functional ( § ORG ) ) or that the property is intended for purposes other than agriculture or forestry ( § CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) .

An application for an acquisition permit shall be submitted not DATE after the acquisition took place ( LAW ) . The question of granting a permit based on a purchase or an exchange may not be decided until it has been clarified whether pre - emption according to LAW will be exercised , unless it is obvious that pre - emption will not be exercised ( LAW § CARDINAL ) . The acquisition becomes null and void if the application is not submitted within the prescribed time , or if the permit is refused ( LAW ) .

According to LAW a local municipality may , under certain circumstances , exercise the right of pre - emption in respect of an agreed purchase of a piece of real property which is needed for certain purposes in the public interest .
b. Appeal procedure
Under LAW , LAW an appeal could be lodged with the ORG against decisions in permit matters made by public authorities other than the Government .

Under LAW of LAW an appeal may be lodged with ORG against decisions made by ORG . A decision by ORG may be appealed against to an administrative court , i.e. ORG and then to ORG . Prior to DATE an appeal could be lodged directly with ORG . An appeal may be lodged with ORG against decisions made by ORG . However , by virtue of LAW of ORG ( ORG , ORG ) , leave to appeal is required .
c. Provisions pertaining to expeditious processing

LAW and the DATE Ordinance on Foreign Acquisitions of Real Property ( Förordningen om utländska förvärv av fast egendom m.m . , CARDINAL ) contain no provisions concerning the procedure as far as demands for speediness are concerned , nor do the DATE LAW ( Förordningen om tillstånd till vissa förvärv av fast egendom , DATE ) . However , with respect to cases examined under LAW , LAW ( ORG , GPE ) stipulates that questions concerning acquisition permits shall be examined without delay and that decisions in the matter shall be rendered not DATE after the application was made , unless there are special reasons .

Section CARDINAL of the Administrative Procedure Act ( ORG , CARDINAL ) , which contains general rules governing the procedure before the administrative authorities and which is applicable to the procedure before ORG and ORG , prescribes that cases shall be handled as simply , rapidly and economically as is possible without jeopardising legal security ( Section CARDINAL ) . There are no special provisions concerning how rapidly cases are to be handled before the administrative courts in ORG .
